alert.note: Alert for Kit Carson County; Yuma County (Colorado) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Goodland (Northwestern Kansas and East Central Colorado)
info.headline: Winter Storm Watch issued December 24 at 12:06PM MST until December 27 at 5:00AM MST by NWS Goodland
info.description: ...WINTER STORM WATCH IN EFFECT FROM MONDAY MORNING THROUGH LATE TUESDAY NIGHT... * WHAT...Blizzard conditions possible. Total snow accumulations of 2 to 5 inches possible. Winds could gust as high as 55 mph. * WHERE...Portions of east central and northeast Colorado, northwest Kansas and southwest Nebraska. * WHEN...From Monday morning through late Tuesday night. * IMPACTS...Plan on slippery road conditions. Areas of blowing snow could significantly reduce visibility. The hazardous conditions could impact the morning or evening commute. Gusty winds could bring down tree branches. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...This storm would make travel hazardous, if not dangerous, late Christmas day and into the day after Christmas. If you have any Christmas travel plans, be prepared to adjust based on weather conditions.
info.instruction: Prepare for possible blizzard conditions. Continue to monitor the latest forecasts for updates on this situation.
